steps.title: Quiz your guests with some tricky science trivia.
steps.content: Quiz your guests with some tricky science trivia. Test their knowledge (and how well they paid attention in science class!) with these tough questions about the human body, nature, space, and chemistry: Question: What is the chemical symbol for salt? Answer: NaCl Question: What are the three layers of the earth? Answer: Crust, mantle, and core Question: What is the only metal that is liquid at room temperature? Answer: Mercury Question: What is the most abundant gas in the Earth’s atmosphere? Answer: Nitrogen Question: Which scientist is famous for his 3 laws of motion? Answer: Isaac Newton Question: How many elements are there on the periodic table? Answer: 118 Question: What is the waste product of photosynthesis? Answer Oxygen gas Question: Which scientist is known for the theory of evolution? Answer: Charles Darwin Question: At what temperature does water boil? Answer: 212°F (100°C) [1] X Research source Question: What travels faster, light or sound? Answer: Light [2] X Research source

steps.title: Test the animal lovers with some zoology trivia.
steps.content: Test the animal lovers with some zoology trivia. These questions about animals are perfect for the science buffs, and those who just happen to be fans of furry friends. Question: What is the largest mammal on Earth? Answer: The blue whale Question: What is the fastest flying insect in the world? Answer: Dragonfly Question: What is the only species of bear found south of the equator? Answer: The spectacled bear Question: What animal has 3 hearts? Answer: Octopus Question: What is an animal that eats both meat and plants called? Answer: An omnivore Question: What does a bat use to navigate and locate prey? Answer: Echolocation Question: What’s the fastest land animal? Answer: Cheetah Question: What is a group of crows called? Answer: A murder Question: What is the only mammal that can fly? Answer: Bat Question: How many bones do sharks have? Answer: 0 [3] X Research source Question: What is a group of porcupines called? Answer: A prickle [4] X Research source

steps.title: Quiz the biology buffs with some trivia about the human body.
steps.content: Quiz the biology buffs with some trivia about the human body. Members of the group who paid attention in anatomy class or who aspire to be doctors one day will definitely earn their team some points with these questions! Question: What are the 4 lobes of the human brain? Answer: Temporal, parietal, frontal, and occipital Question: What blood type is known as the “universal donor”? Answer: O negative Question: What is the largest organ in the human body? Answer: The skin Question: What are the three bones that make up your arm? Answer: The humerus, the ulna, and the radius Question: How many teeth does an adult human have? Answer: 32 Question: Which tendon is named after a famous figure in Greek mythology? Answer: Achilles tendon Question: What is the longest bone in the human body? Answer: Femur Question: How many chambers does a human heart have? Answer: 4 Question: What is the outermost layer of skin called? Answer: Epidermis Question: Where is the ACL located? Answer: Knee Question: The “nares” are another name for which part of your body? Answer: Nostrils Question: How many bones are there in the human body? Answer: 206 [5] X Research source

steps.title: Shoot for the stars with some astronomy and outer space trivia.
steps.content: Shoot for the stars with some astronomy and outer space trivia. These questions are perfect for the aspiring astronauts out there, or for those who just happen to love stargazing and learning about the universe. Question: What is the hottest planet in our solar system? Answer: Venus Question: Who was the first man to walk on the moon? Answer: Neil Armstrong Question: Which planet in our solar system has the most gravity? Answer: Jupiter Question: Who was the first American woman in space? Answer: Sally Ride Question: Which two planets in our solar system have no moons? Answer: Mercury and Venus Question: What is another name for the North Star? Answer: Polaris Question: What was the first vegetable to be grown in space? Answer: Potato Question: What is the closest star to Earth (besides the Sun)? Answer: Proxima Centauri Question: How far away is the moon from Earth? Answer: 238,900 [6] X Research source Question: What galaxy is closest to ours? Answer: Andromeda Galaxy [7] X Research source

steps.title: Test the history buffs with these questions about the past.
steps.content: Test the history buffs with these questions about the past. If you or your guests are experts on history, these fun questions will give you a chance to rack up some points. They also cover a wide range of historical periods and topics, including U.S., European, ancient, and world history, so you’ll be able to really show off your skills! Question: Which Renaissance artist painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel? Answer: Michelangelo Question: Which country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the U.S.? Answer: France Question: In which year did the Titanic sink? Answer: 1912 Question: Who was the first Black justice on the Supreme Court of the U.S.? Answer: Thurgood Marshall Question: In which country did the first Olympic Games take place? Answer: Greece Question: Who were the last king and queen of France before the French revolution? Answer: King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette Question: In which year did the Berlin Wall fall? Answer: 1989 Question: Who was the Ancient Greek goddess of wisdom and war? Answer: Athena Question: In which war did the most American soldiers die? Answer: The Civil War Question: What ancient civilization built Machu Picchu? Answer: The Incas Question: What was the name of the Russian royal family from 1613 to 1917? Answer: The Romanovs Question: Which American civil rights leader gave the famous “I Have a Dream” speech? Answer: Martin Luther King Jr. Question: Who was the longest reigning British monarch? Answer: Queen Elizabeth II Question: What ancient wonder of the world is still standing today? Answer: The Great Pyramid of Giza [8] X Research source Question: What is the oldest known civilization in the world? Answer: Mesopotamia [9] X Research source Question: The oldest bottled condiment continuously sold in the U.S. wasn't invented in the U.S. It was first sold in 1837 in which 14-letter English county? Answer: Worcestershire

steps.title: Find out how well you know the world with some geography trivia.
steps.content: Find out how well you know the world with some geography trivia. These questions about continents, countries, and cities are perfect for the geography buffs and world travelers, and they may even give you some ideas for your next vacation. Question: What is the largest ocean in the world? Answer: The Pacific Ocean Question: What is the capital of India? Answer: New Delhi Question: Where is the deepest point in the ocean located? Answer: The Mariana Trench Question: What is the only continent that spans all four hemispheres? Answer: Africa Question: What is the largest desert in the world? Answer: Antarctica Question: Which river runs through Paris, France? Answer: The Seine Question: What is the tallest mountain in the world? Answer: Mount Everest Question: Which country is also a continent? Answer: Australia Question: What is the smallest country in the world by land area? Answer: Vatican City Question: In which U.S. state is the Grand Canyon located? Answer: Arizona Question: What is the longest river in China? Answer: The Yangtze River Question: What 3 U.S. states border California? Answer: Oregon, Nevada, and Arizona Question: Which country has the most naturally occurring lakes? Answer: Canada Question: What is the only city in the world that straddles two continents? Answer: Istanbul, Turkey [10] X Research source Question: What was the U.S.’s first national park? Answer: Yellowstone National Park [11] X Research source

steps.title: Test avid readers with these tricky trivia about books.
steps.content: Test avid readers with these tricky trivia about books. We’ve compiled a wide range of questions, so there are chances for all kinds of book lovers to score some points, whether they’re fans of classic literature or more modern titles. Question: Who wrote the 1811 novel Sense and Sensibility ? Answer: Jane Austen Question: What do citizens call the dictator in George Orwell’s 1984 ? Answer: Big Brother Question: What is the title of the third Harry Potter book? Answer: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban Question: Which Ancient Greek poet is the author of The Iliad and The Odyssey ? Answer: Homer Question: What classic novel opens with the line “Call me Ishmael”? Answer: Moby Dick Question: What is the name of the fictional dystopian country in The Hunger Games ? Answer: Panem Question: What is Frankenstein’s first name in the classic novel by Mary Shelley? Answer: Victor Question: Which Nobel and Pulitzer prize winning author wrote Beloved ? Answer: Toni Morrison Question: Which character is the narrator in The Great Gatsby ? Answer: Nick Carraway Question: What is the name of Dante’s epic poem about a journey through hell, purgatory, and heaven? Answer: The Divine Comedy Question: Which Victorian novel features the character Mr. Rochester as a love interest? Answer: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Brontë Question What is the main character’s name in The Handmaid’s Tale? Answer Offred Question: Where does Shakespeare’s play Romeo and Juliet take place? Answer: Verona, Italy Question: Which Victorian author wrote David Copperfield ? Answer: Charles Dickens Question: Jack White is the name of a supervillain from comic book fame. Name him? Answer: it's a Joker, since a deck of cards typically has 52 cards, but if there's an extra card.

steps.title: Ask some tough movie questions for all the film buffs.
steps.content: Ask some tough movie questions for all the film buffs. These fun questions about films, directors, and actors are sure to get all the movie lovers invested in a trivia night. We’ve also included questions that span a wide range of film history, so lovers of classic cinema and modern box-office hits will all get a chance to win some points. Question: Who directed the 2023 movie Barbie ? Answer: Greta Gerwig Question: What is the highest grossing movie of all time? Answer: Avatar (2009) Question: Who plays the character of Rose DeWitt Bukater in Titanic ? Answer: Kate Winslet Question: What was Disney’s first full-length animated movie? Answer: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs Question: What is the name of the hotel in The Shining ? Answer: The Overlook Hotel Question: Who was the first person to receive an Oscar nomination for acting in a Marvel movie? Answer: Angela Bassett Question What 1995 rom-com is loosely based on Jane Austen’s novel Emma ? Answer: Clueless Question: Who directed both Crazy Rich Asians (2018) and Wicked (2024)? Answer: John M. Chu Question: What is the name of the popular clique in Mean Girls ? Answer: The Plastics Question: Who plays Jay Gatsby in Baz Luhrman’s film adaptation of The Great Gatsby ? Answer: Leonardo DiCaprio Question: Who directed Pulp Fiction and Once Upon a Time… in Hollywood ? Answer: Quentin Tarantino Question: Which actress has the most Academy Award nominations of all time? Answer: Meryl Streep (21 nominations) Question: Who was the actress Liza Minelli's mother? Answer: Judy Garland Question: What movie musical stars Emma Stone as an aspiring actress and Ryan Gosling as a jazz musician? Answer: La La Land (2016) Question: Who directed E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982)? Answer: Steven Spielberg

steps.title: Sprinkle in some music trivia to test the music lovers.
steps.content: Sprinkle in some music trivia to test the music lovers. These questions about musicians, hit songs, and iconic performances are perfect for the members of the group who are pop culture experts. Those who never leave their house without their headphones are bound to score some major points for their teams! Question: Which musician has the most Grammys of all time? Answer: Beyoncé (35 awards) Question: Who was the first winner of American Idol ? Answer: Kelly Clarkson Question: What is the highest selling band of all time? Answer: The Beatles Question: What animal did Britney Spears famously hold on her shoulders during a performance? Answer: A snake Question: Who was the first woman inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame? Answer: Aretha Franklin Question: What reality T.V. show did the members of One Direction meet on? Answer: The X Factor Question: What is Rihanna’s real name? Answer: Robyn Rihanna Fenty Question: What Swedish band sings the iconic hit “Dancing Queen?” Answer: ABBA Question: Who was the youngest person to win Album of the Year at the Grammys, and how old were they? Answer: Billie Eilish; 18 years old Question: What was the name of Taylor Swift’s 2023-2024 stadium tour that included music from her entire career? Answer: The Eras Tour Question: Who is the only rapper to have won the Pulitzer Prize? Answer: Kendrick Lamar Question: Which iconic country artist is Miley Cyrus’s godmother? Answer: Dolly Parton Question: What is the highest selling album of all time? Answer: Thriller by Michael Jackson Question: Who was the drummer in the band Nirvana? Answer: Dave Grohl Question: What name is the musician Stefani Germanotta better known by? Answer: Lady Gaga Question: What is the name of the song that repeats the lyrics "a little bit softer now" 17 times and "a little bit louder now" 12 times? Answer: "Shout" by The Isley Brothers

steps.title: Quiz the fanatics with some fun sports trivia.
steps.content: Quiz the fanatics with some fun sports trivia. Whether they’re fans of watching sports or actually play sports themselves, they’re sure to score some major points for their teams with these questions about football, baseball, basketball, and more! Question: How long is a marathon? Answer: 26.2 miles Question: Which country has played in every single soccer World Cup? Answer: Brazil Question: How many rings are in the Olympic logo? Answer: 5 Question: What is the diameter of a basketball hoop in inches? Answer: 18 inches. Question: What is Muhammad Ali’s real name? Answer: Cassius Clay Question: What is it called when you get 3 strikes in a row in bowling? Answer: A turkey Question: What is the name of the trophy given to Super Bowl champions? Answer: The Vince Lombardi Trophy Question: In baseball, when is “Take Me Out to the Ballgame” traditionally sung? Answer: The 7th inning Question: Which sporting event is held over memorial day weekend? Answer: The Indianapolis 500 Question: Which athlete has won the most olympic medals? Answer: Michael Phelps (28) [12] X Research source

steps.title: Looking for some extra tough trivia questions?
steps.content: Looking for some extra tough trivia questions? These super tricky options are sure to stump even the most knowledgeable trivia buff. They’re perfect for a tie-breaker round, or if you’re hosting a game night for a bunch of trivia experts. Question: What is the name of Jupiter’s biggest moon? Answer: Ganymede Question: How many countries are in the European Union? Answer: 27 Question: What is Scout’s real name in To Kill a Mockingbird ? Answer: Jean Louise Finch Question: Which actress is in all 3 of the highest grossing movies of all time? Answer: Zoe Saldaña Question: What U.S. president was the teddy bear named after? Answer: President Theodore (Teddy) Roosevelt Question: What was Shakespeare’s wife’s name? Answer: Anne Hathaway Question: What German word is used to describe a coming-of-age novel? Answer: Bildungsroman Question: Who was the first woman to win the Nobel Prize? Answer: Marie Curie Question: How many moons does Saturn have? Answer: 146 Question: Which Romantic poet was Mary Shelley married to? Answer: Percy Bysshe Shelley Question: What is the smallest bone in the human body? Answer: The stapes (also known as the stirrup) located in the ear Question: Which country has the largest population in the world? Answer: India Question: Which event is widely thought to have sparked World War I? Answer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand Question: What is the longest running broadway show in history? Answer: The Phantom of the Opera Question: Which famous composer was completely deaf by his mid 40’s? Answer: Beethoven

steps.title: Go easy on guests with some general questions.
steps.content: Go easy on guests with some general questions. These trivia questions are about things that technically should be common knowledge, but they’re still tricky enough to keep things interesting. This makes them a perfect place to start if you want to give guests a chance to warm up before shifting to super tough questions, or if you’re hosting a trivia night for beginners. Question: What does the “www” stand for at the start of website addresses? Answer: World Wide Web Question: What are the tiny pieces at the end of shoelaces called? Answer: Aglets Question: In what year was the first iPhone released? Answer: 2007 Question: What two colors mixed together make green? Answer: Blue and yellow Question: What does the SPF stand for in sunscreen products? Answer: Sun Protection Factor Question: What is another title for the Bishop of Rome in the Catholic church? Answer: The Pope Question: How many millimeters are in a meter? Answer: 1000 Question: Which museum is the Mona Lisa located at? Answer: The Louvre Question: What is the best selling book of all time? Answer: The Bible Question: Who invented the telephone? Answer: Alexander Graham Bell Question: Which month has either 28 or 29 days, depending on the year? Answer: February Question: What is a fear of spiders called? Answer: Arachnophobia Question: What is a word that reads the same backwards and forwards called? Answer: A palindrome Question: What is the only letter that doesn’t appear in any U.S. state name? Answer: Q
